meanings.definition: To make something seem larger, more important, better, or worse than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She overexaggerated her role in the school play to impress her friends.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overexaggerate his fishing stories to make them more exciting.
meanings.sent3: The cat overexaggerated its hunting skills by pouncing on a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The storm overexaggerated its strength, causing trees to bend and sway.
meanings.sent5: The artist overexaggerated the size of the sun in her painting, making it dominate the sky.

meanings.sent1: The politician overexaggerated the benefits of his new policy during the speech.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overexaggerate her achievements to gain recognition.
meanings.sent3: The comedian overexaggerated his fear of spiders for a laugh.
meanings.sent4: The author overexaggerated the impact of the character's decision, adding drama to the story.
meanings.sent5: The child overexaggerated the size of the fish he caught, describing it as a giant monster.
